course.title: The 18th Century: Ethical Dilemmas
course.description: Questions how notions of personhood and otherness inhabit the emergent novel, exploring the way in which events and values are resisted or subsumed in literary discourse and the kind of social and political responsibility that accompanies it. Readings will be taken from the works of Charriere, Gouges, Laclos, Marivaux, Montesquieu, Rousseau, Sade, Voltaire, etc.
course.notes: Conducted in French. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Ethical Reasoning.
